intro: Chamaesyce katrajensis var. kasaragodensis, commonly known as the Kasaragod chamaesyce, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its foliage is often covered in fine hairs, and it produces a distinctive cyathium structure typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. This variant is notable for its geographic specificity and ecological adaptation to its native habitat.
